ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Respondent
Notes: NA=Not Applicable

ElementDescription: Please list your most recent discharge from inpatient, residential, or partial hospitalization program for an eating disorder. If you have not been in this type of treatment setting, please list NA.
Date of discharge
Notes: MM/DD/YYYY

ElementDescription: Type of facility discharged from (inpatient, residential, partial hospitalization program, etc)
How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was provided with clear information on my diagnosis.
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was provided with clear information on my prognosis.
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was told about non-urgent symptoms that may occur and how I should cope with these.
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was given information on symptoms that may signal a need to seek urgent medical attention and whom to contact for these symptoms (e.g., specialist, family physician, homecare).
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was told about clinical findings that may impact my future health or care (e.g., history of blood clots, cancer, high blood pressure).
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was given complete information on my medications (e.g., type, purpose, how given, when, how often for how long, how much, side effects, drug interactions, nature, and frequency of blood work).
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was given dietary instructions (e.g., requirements, restrictions, instructions to plan daily meals).
Notes: 1= Strongly disagree; 2= Somewhat disagree; 3= Hard to decide; 4= Somewhat disagree; 5= Strongly agree; 6= Not applicable

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was provided with information on recommendations and restrictions in activities, exercises, and aids.

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was given information on medical equipment and supplies (e.g., what needed, whom to contact).

ElementDescription: How strongly do you agree or disagree with the following statements BEFORE discharge? I was given information on follow-up appointments that have been made for me and appointments I have to schedule for myself.
